org.productivity.java.habitat4j.common.interfaces
Interface ReloadEventHandlerIF

All Known Implementing Classes:
SampleReloadEventHandler
public interface ReloadEventHandlerIF

Interface used to implement the preReload, postReload, and onReloadFailure event methods. In a class that implements this interface: If preReload(..) returns true, the reload will continue. If false, the reload will be interrupted and old properties will remain available to the application. If postReload(..) returns true, the reload will continue. If false, the reload will be interrupted and old properties will remain available to the application. onReloadFailure can be used to take action upon a failure.

Method Detail

preReload

public boolean preReload(PropertyList oldPropertyList)
Parameters:
oldPropertyList - - the PropertyList instance available prior to the reload
Returns:
Returns "true" if the reload process should continue, else "false"

postReload

public boolean postReload(PropertyList oldPropertyList,
                          PropertyList newPropertyList)
Parameters:
oldPropertyList - - the PropertyList instance available prior to the reload
newPropertyList - - the PropertyList instance available after reload
Returns:
Returns "true" if the reload process should continue, else "false"

onReloadFailure

public void onReloadFailure(PropertyList oldPropertyList,
                            PropertyListHandlerException exception)
Parameters:
oldPropertyList - - the PropertyList instance available prior to the reload
exception - - the PropertyListHandlerException instance that will be thrown by Habitat4J
